00040 #ifndef __CVMX_CSR_DB_H__
00041 #define __CVMX_CSR_DB_H__
00042 
00043 /**
00044  * @file
00045  * Interface for the Octeon CSR database.
00046  *
00047  *
00048  * <hr>$Revision: 127322 $<hr>
00049  *
00050  */
00051 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00052 #include "cvmx-platform.h"
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00056 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00057 extern "C" {
00058 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 typedef enum {
00062     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_RSL,        /**< Octeon internal address, but indirect and slow (not used for addresses) */
00063     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_NCB,        /**< Octeon internal address */
00064     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCI_NCB,
00065                      /**< Can be accessed through PCI BAR0, also an NCB alias (not used for addresses) */
00066     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCICONFIG,
00067                      /**< PCI Config, also an NCB alias */
00068     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCI,        /**< PCI BAR0 (only) */
00069     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PEXP,
00070                      /**< PCIe BAR 0 address only */
00071     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PEXP_NCB,
00072                      /**< NCB-direct and PCIe BAR0 address */
00073     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PEXPV_NCB,
00074                      /**< NCB-direct and PCIe BAR0 address for O3 */
00075     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCICONFIGEP,
00076                      /**< PCIe config address (EP mode) + indirect through PESC*_CFG_RD/PESC*_CFG_WR */
00077     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCICONFIGRC,
00078                      /**< PCICONFIGRC - PCIe config address (RC mode) + indirect through PESC*_CFG_RD/PESC*_CFG_WR */
00079     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_SRIOMAINT,
00080                      /**< SRIOMAINT - SRIO maintenance registers */
00081     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_BPHY_RSL
00082                      /**< BPHY - Baseband PHY registers */
00083 } CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_FIELD;
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * the structure for the cvmx_csr_db_addresses[] array that
00087  * holds all possible Octeon CSR addresses
00088  */
00089 typedef struct {
00090     char *name;         /**< CSR name at the supplied address */
00091     uint64_t address;       /**< Address = octeon internal, PCI BAR0 relative, PCI CONFIG relative */
00092     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_FIELD type:8;
00093                     /**< the type */
00094     uint8_t widthbits;      /**< the width of the CSR in bits */
00095     uint16_t csroff;        /**< position of the CSR in cvmx_csr_db[] */
00096 } __attribute__ ((packed)) CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE;
00097 
00098 /**
00099  * the structure for the cvmx_csr_db_fields[] array that
00100  * holds all possible Octeon CSR fields
00101  */
00102 typedef struct {
00103     char *name;         /**< name of the field */
00104     uint8_t startbit;       /**< starting bit position of the field */
00105     uint8_t sizebits;       /**< the size of the field in bits */
00106     uint16_t csroff;        /**< position of the CSR containing the field in cvmx_csr_db[] (get alias from there) */
00107     char *type;         /**< the type of the field R/W, R/W1C, ... */
00108     uint8_t rst_unp;        /**< set if the reset value is unknown */
00109     uint8_t typ_unp;        /**< set if the typical value is unknown */
00110     uint64_t rst_val;       /**< the reset value of the field */
00111     uint64_t typ_val;       /**< the typical value of the field */
00112 } __attribute__ ((packed)) __CVMX_CSR_DB_FIELD_TYPE;
00113 
00114 /**
00115  * the structure for the cvmx_csr_db[] array that holds all
00116  * possible Octeon CSR forms
00117  */
00118 typedef struct {
00119     char *basename;         /**< the base name of the CSR */
00120     CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_FIELD type:8;
00121                     /**< the type */
00122     uint8_t widthbits;      /**< the width of the CSR in bits */
00123     uint8_t numfields;      /**< the number of fields in the CSR (and in cvmx_csr_db_csr_fields[]) */
00124     uint16_t fieldoff;      /**< the position of the first field in cvmx_csr_db_csr_fields[] */
00125     uint64_t baseaddr;
00126     uint16_t incoff;
00127 } __attribute__ ((packed)) __CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE;
00128 
00129 /**
00130  * This NULL terminated array contains the CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE
00131  * arrays for each chip. Each array entry is another NULL
00132  * terminated array of CSRs.
00133  */
00134 extern const __CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE *__cvmx_csr_db[];
00135 
00136 /**
00137  * This 0 terminated array contains the count of the entries
00138  * in the per chip arrays. This is used to skip counting
00139  * the members of the CSR arrays.
00140  */
00141 extern const int __cvmx_csr_db_cnt[];
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * Internal 2-dim array to hold the increment values for CSR addresses.
00145  */
00146 extern const uint64_t __csrdb_addrinc[][4];
00147 
00148 /**
00149  * This NULL terminated array contains the CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE
00150  * arrays for each chip. Each array entry is another NULL
00151  * terminated array of CSR addresses.
00152  */
00153 extern const CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE *cvmx_csr_db_addresses[];
00154 
00155 /**
00156  * This NULL terminated array contains the CVMX_CSR_DB_FIELD_TYPE
00157  * arrays for each chip. Each array entry is another NULL
00158  * terminated array of CSR fields.
00159  */
00160 extern const __CVMX_CSR_DB_FIELD_TYPE *__cvmx_csr_db_fields[];
00161 
00162 /**
00163  * Figure out which database to use for this chip. The passed
00164  * identifier can be a processor ID or a PCI ID.
00165  *
00166  * @param identifier processor ID or a PCI ID
00167  *
00168  * @return index into the csr db
00169  */
00170 extern int cvmx_db_get_chipindex(int identifier);
00171 
00172 /**
00173  * Get the CSR DB entry for the passed Octeon model and CSR name. The
00174  * model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.
00175  *
00176  * @param identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
00177  * @param name       CSR name to lookup
00178  *
00179  * @return CSR DB entry or NULL on failure
00180  */
00181 #if __GNUC__ > 4 || (__GNUC__ >= 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 7)
00182 extern const CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE *cvmx_csr_db_get(int identifier, const char *name) __attribute__ ((deprecated("don't use cvmx_csr_db_get(), instead use cvmx_csr_db_get_params()")));;
00183 #else
00184 extern const CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE *cvmx_csr_db_get(int identifier, const char *name) __attribute__ ((deprecated));
00185 #endif
00186 
00187 /**
00188  * Decode a CSR value into named bitfields. The model can either
00189  * be specified as a processor id or PCI id.
00190  *
00191  * @param identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
00192  * @param address    CSR address being decoded
00193  * @param value      Value to decode
00194  */
00195 extern void cvmx_csr_db_decode(int identifier, uint64_t address, uint64_t value);
00196 
00197 /**
00198  * Decode a CSR value into named bitfields. The model can either
00199  * be specified as a processor id or PCI id.
00200  *
00201  * @param identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
00202  * @param csr_name       CSR name to decode
00203  * @param value      Value to decode
00204  */
00205 extern void cvmx_csr_db_decode_by_name(int identifier, char *csr_name, uint64_t value);
00206 
00207 extern void cvmx_csr_db_decode_by_name_node(int node, int identifier, char *csr_name, uint64_t value);
00208 
00209 /**
00210  * Print or decode all csrs names beginning with a prefix. The
00211  * model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.
00212  * For decoding it must not be remote.
00213  *
00214  * @param identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
00215  * @param prefix     Beginning prefix to look for
00216  * @param decode      If == 0 - print the entry; else decode it.
00217  */
00218 int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_prefix(int identifier, const char *prefix, int decode);
00219 
00220 int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_prefix_node(int node, int identifier, const char *prefix, int decode);
00221 
00222 /**
00223  * Print CSR given in the form "lmc(0..0)_char_mask(0..4)". This means that
00224  * this func will pring all the CSRs with names that end on 0 to 4.
00225  * The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.
00226  *
00227  * @param identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
00228  * @param basename   CSR name as is in CSR DB
00229  * @param pattern    The pattern that user searches for
00230  * @param decode      If == 0 - print the entry; else decode it.
00231  * 
00232  * @return 0 on success, <0 on error
00233  */
00234 int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_basename(int identifier, char *basename, char *pattern, int decode);
00235 
00236 int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_basename_node(int node, int identifier, char *basename, char *pattern, int decode);
00237 
00238 /**
00239  * Return an uint64_t for a csr where the bits for all the reserved fields are
00240  * set to 1.
00241  *
00242  * @param identifier is the processor ID or a PCI ID.
00243  * @param csr_defname is the macro name of a CSR, as defined in the cvmx-xxxx-defs.h.
00244  *
00245  * @return (uint64_t)-1 for error.
00246  */
00247 extern uint64_t cvmx_csr_db_rsvd_mask(int identifier, char *csr_defname);
00248 
00249 /**
00250  * Given DB identifer and csr_name, find out the CSR's address, type,
00251  * basename and CSR width.
00252  *
00253  * @return 0 for success, 
00254  *    -1 if the csr_name doesn't match anything in the database, and
00255  *    -2 if the match is found but an index is out of range.
00256  *
00257  * Note: the function uses binary search over the database. This requires that
00258  * the database entries are in assending order wrt the CSR basename.
00259  */
00260 extern int cvmx_csr_db_get_params(int identifier, char *csr_name, uint64_t *paddr,
00261     int *ptype, char **pbasename, int *pwidth);
00262 
00263 /**
00264  * Given the CSR name, print the decoded values of the node-local register(s).
00265  * CSR name format = CSR name as provided in HRM doc, with index ranges or
00266  * specific index numbers.
00267  * Example 1: "PKI_CL(0..3)_SMEM(0..2047)"
00268  * Example 2: "PKI_CL1_SMEM16"
00269  *
00270  * @param csr_name    CSR name
00271  */
00272 void cvmx_csr_db_reg_dump(char *csr_name);
00273 void cvmx_csr_db_reg_dump_node(int node, char *csr_name);
00274 
00275 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00276 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00277 }
00278 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00279 #endif
00280 #endif
